result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Ray Stockwell

records.addlTxt:
2:25 PM Defendant Tyler Ray Stockwell in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant states that he is not eligible for public defender representation.
Defendant is informed that he can petition the court for a court appointed attorney.
State is in compliance with victim rights legislation.
Victim is present and makes a brief statement.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Defendant to complete the paperwork for a court appointed attorney and go to Branch 1 Office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:03 PM Defendant Tyler Ray Stockwell appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner is present in court.
Court questions the Atty Bergner for Defendant as to the reason for missing Court. 
State request the warrant be quashed and the signature bond be converted to a cash bond.
Objection by Atty Bergner is heard by the court and request the signature bond be reinstated.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed, prior forfeiture of signature bond is vacated and is reinstated to be co-signed by his mother Brenda. Latza.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Amended Restitution Summary. $5,700.00 total. Filed by Prosecutor.

1:21 PM Defendant Tyler Ray Stockwell not in court. Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 


BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant - body only 
Statewide
Signature bond is forfeited

Reinstated 09-23-2022,
No contact with the victims as listed in the complaint, L.K.G. and J.M.R.
Mother to co-sign bond.

2:17 PM Defendant Tyler Ray Stockwell in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
ADA Pfeil calls the case and states the appearances.
Several victims appear in court today.
Defendant appears without counsel.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Complaint has a typo and the State will amend the complaint to the correct date as stated on the record.

BY THE COURT: 
Court approval for amendment of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant questions what indigent means.
Court informs him of the indigency and provides the defendant with information for the public defender's office.
If not eligible for a public defender can petition the court for a court appointed attorney but needs to be determined ineligible with the public defender's office.
Defendant is informed that he can hire his own attorney if not eligible for a public defender or court appointed attorney.
ADA Pfeil is not certain if any of the victims wish to make a statement and would ask that the court check with them.
Court questions the victims if they wish to make a statement today.
Victim, M.L., makes a statement today.
Court questions ADA Pfeil if this victim is listed as a victim in the complaint; ADA Pfeil will follow up with this information.
M.L. to follow up with the DA's Office or Law Enforcement Agency to see if he is a victim that will be included in the complaint. 
No other victims wish to make a statement.
Defendant is informed that the will not be speaking of the facts of the case today but does make a statement.
Court stops the defendant 

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Case is adjourned.
Defendant to go to the public defender's office today.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Restitution Summary filed by the State
Initial Appearance set for August 29, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 1
